sentences.sContent: After pinpointing their location via satellite tracker, rescue crews drilled a narrow hole down into the shaft, pumping in air to pressurize the chamber and keep the water at bay.
sentences.sContent_eng: After pinpointing their location via satellite tracker, rescue crews drilled a narrow hole down into the shaft, pumping in air to pressurize the chamber and keep the water at bay.
sentences.sCn: 在通过卫星追踪器确定了矿工们在地下所处位置后，救援人员钻开了一个窄洞，然后泵入空气进行增压将水阻挡住；

synos.tran: 密封；增压；使……加压，使……压入

words.tran: 加压的；有使血压增高的；收缩血管的
压；按；新闻；出版社；[印刷] 印刷机
增压；密封；使…加压（pressurize的过去式）

trans.tranOther: to increase the pressure in (an enclosure, such as an aircraft cabin) in order to maintain approximately atmospheric pressure when the external pressure is low
